eHealth: the transformation of the healthcare model

Digital literacy and skills in health, empowerment in health, participatory health and wellbeing, design and evaluation of eHealth and mHealth interventions, data science in health, and equity are some of the subjects covered by eHealth and you will find them all in this dossier.

Digital literacy and digital skills in health

For some years now, the Internet has been a part of our daily lives and health-related information plays a key role. 80% of users search for information on health issues and apply the knowledge they acquire to deal with or resolve a health problem.

Alfabetización en salud de la información a la acción (Literacy in health, from information to action) link opens in a new window

Book with participations by 40 authors, who tackle from different approaches the process of transforming information and knowledge into practical decisions with tangible results in terms of health benefits.

IC-Health - Improving the digital health literacy of European citizens link opens in a new window

European project financed by H2020 which promotes the improvement of the digital literacy of European Union citizens in health-related matters.

European citizens' digital health literacy link opens in a new window

Evaluation of the degree to which European citizens use the Internet and online resources to monitor their own health. The report was drafted by the European Union.

Development of the Digital Health Literacy Instrument: Measuring a Broad Spectrum of Health 1.0 and Health 2.0 Skills link opens in a new window

Dutch study on digital literacy in health, published in the Journal of Medical Internet Research.

Van der Vaart, R. [Rosalie] and Drossaert, C. [Constance]. (2017). Development of the digital health literacy instrument: measuring a broad spectrum of health 1.0 and health 2.0 skills. Journal of Medical Internet Research, 19(1), e27. https://doi.org/10.2196/jmir.6709

Design and assessment of eHealth & mHealth interventions

Interventions via eHealth and mHealth are becoming increasingly important and commonplace. However, the design and assessment of these tools are key to ensuring reliability during their use.

Digital Apps Library link opens in a new window

Library of Digital Apps compiled by the NHS. We can find some which have been approved, which means that there is clinical evidence and that they support clinical results, or others which are being tested, which means that they are part of a programme being supervised by the NHS where evidence is being gathered.

Evaluation of Digital Health Interventions and Medical Devices link opens in a new window

Report on digital interventions and initiatives relating to the promotion of health and presented as part of a seminar. It analyses some of the opportunities offered by these initiatives and describes specific cases, for example, mobile apps applied to the monitoring of health problems, among other issues.

Exploring how health professionals create eHealth and mHealth education interventions link opens in a new window

Qualitative study which aims to investigate how health professionals use instructional design principles to create health interventions. In this study, a sample of twelve participants was selected and as a general result it was observed that the participants incorporated key elements of instructional design in their interventions, in other words, analysis, design and assessment.

Tamim, S. [Suha] and Grant, M. [Michael]. (2016). Exploring how health professionals create eHealth and mHealth education interventions. Educational Technology Research and Development, 64, 1053-1081. https://doi.org/10.1007/s11423-016-9447-4

Mobile World Congress – mHealth link opens in a new window

Dedicates a significant part to mobile health, in which important organizations such as the ECHAlliance participate. It has been held in Barcelona since 2006 and is one of the most important congresses in the world for the mobile phone industry.

Data science in Health

This new trend with the Internet and social media, the success of smart phones and the emergence of sensors and big data, which not only include clinical and operational registers, but also text, audio and video and biometric registers, can be analysed to provide useful information for health systems.

Big data report on digital health link opens in a new window

Analysis of the situation, implications and trends in the evolution of big data in health. Report produced by the Vodafone Spain Foundation and Red.es.

Data science, learning, and applications to biomedical and health sciences link opens in a new window

Workshop for researchers which deals with the big data phenomenon in relation to health sciences and biomedicine.

Health Care Data Science for Quality Improvement and Patient Safety link opens in a new window

Deals with the importance of the new role of healthcare professionals who specialize in data science.

eHealth & equality

Equality applied to eHealth is a promising perspective in the fight against inequalities in health.

ePractice link opens in a new window

Community which offers services for the professional electronic government community (eGovernment), digital inclusion (eInclusion) and eHealth which are part of Joinup, a programme created by the European Commission. It is an interactive initiative which allows its users to discuss in open access the way in which public administrations operate with regard to providing services to the community.

eHealth Equity: how to meet the needs of people with poor health literacy? link opens in a new window

Presentation by Chandra-Verstappen, speaker at the eHealth Week 2016 congress, who speaks from her own experience as Director of the Pharos patient participation programme (Dutch Centre of Expertise on Health Disparities). In it, she confirms that eHealth is a promising perspective in the fight against inequalities in health.

Digital Health Equity: Humanizing eHealth link opens in a new window

Explores the benefits and barriers in the use of eHealth by women of low income and women of colour. According to the report, women of low income and women of colour with chronic health conditions use eHealth tools such as electronic medical records and social media to manage their health. However, certain improvements need to be made, such as: limited digital literacy, privacy problems and lack of technology.

Applicable legislation

In Spain there is no specific regulation in the subject matter; however the applicable legislation is listed below.

Law 16/2003 on the cohesion and quality of the National Health System link opens in a new window

Establishes cooperation actions of public health administrations to ensure the successful running of the National Health System.

Organic Law 15/1999, of 13 December, on the protection of personal data link opens in a new window

Known as the LOPD, it guarantees the protection of the basic rights of persons, such as the right to honour and to privacy, limiting and regulating the use of information technology for the processing of personal data.

Royal Decree 1720/2007: of Organic Law 15/1999, of 13 December, on the protection of personal data link opens in a new window

Decree which approves the implementing legislation of the LOPD in order to protect personal rights in the processing of personal data.

Law 34/2002, of 11 July, on information society services and e-commerce link opens in a new window

Establishes a regulation on information society services. In other words, it aims to establish an appropriate legal framework for services contracted or provided by electronic means.

Law 14/1986, general health law link opens in a new window

Regulates actions in order to guarantee the right to health protection recognized in the Constitution. It also establishes the public provisions and structure of the National Health System. It is a basic piece of legislation applicable throughout Spain.

Law 41/2002 on patient autonomy link opens in a new window

Regulates patient autonomy and the rights and obligations with regard to clinical information and documentation.

Law 34/1988, general advertising law link opens in a new window

Defines the concept of advertising and regulates it in all its fundamental aspects.

Royal Legislative Decree 1/2007: of the general law on consumer and user protection link opens in a new window

Decree which approves the consolidated text which unifies the previous Law 26/1984, of 19 July, and the community directives for protecting the interests of consumers and users.

Royal Decree 81/2014, of 7 February link opens in a new window

Establishes the rules to guarantee cross-border healthcare assistance to patients and promote cooperation between Member States of the European Union in this sphere.

Cross-border healthcare assistance: Directive 2011/24/EU link opens in a new window

Guarantees patient mobility, establishing certain rules to facilitate access to safe and high-quality healthcare within the European Union.
